Name: Allan Davis
Bio:
With a passion for Mobile Development, Allan Davis has been focused on native development for iOS and Android for the past couple of years.   Allan began his career in 1996 while learning basic programming.  Feeling the urge to delve deeper, Allan became certified in Java as a developer and along the way was instrumental in Python development with NetBeans.  He honed his talents with Objective C, and Ruby on Rails.  Allan has long been driven to share his knowledge and offers several classes each year in Mobile and Web Development and has an online video series for Android, iOS and Ruby on Rails applications. 

Allan has several applications in Itunes Store, Play Store and Blackberry.  As the Principle of Cajun Code Software, Allan has several Games in development, genres that include card games, music downloads, space travel and rubrix cross.

Name: Andrew Fuqua
Bio: Andrew Fuqua has been developing software professionally since the mid '80s. Though it wasn?t called Agile back then, his first project used an iterative and incremental approach. After a few years of working in not-so-agile environments, Andrew began using eXtreme Programming in 1999. Andrew is the current president of the Agile Atlanta user group, which he helped start in 2001. Andrew has held positions in management, product management and development at companies like Internet Security Systems, Allure Global, and IBM. Andrew earned a BS and MS in computer science and has an MBA from Duke University. You can reach Andrew as @andrewmfuqua on twitter, through his blog www.andrewfuqua.com, or by email to andrew@leadingagile.com.
Title: Enterprise Agile Coach

Name: Andrew Slivker
Bio: Andrew Slivker, Nevatech co-founder and CTO, has spent more than decade building and managing SOA platforms that bring business capacity to enterprise communications. He designed SOA systems that are used around the world and handle billions of transactions per year. A Microsoft technologies veteran with more than 25 years of experience in software architecture and implementations, Andrew Slivker has worked in large enterprise organizations and successful startups. Prior to joining Nevatech he served as a Director of Microsoft Development for SOA Software, and Senior VP of Applications Development for Listman Home Technologies where he designed and orchestrated development of the world's first Microsoft-based SOA implementation of the Universal Plug-and-Play Home Automation system. As a Chief Technology Officer of Nevatech, Andrew Slivker works on the next-generation SOA and API management solutions with unique focus on support and integration with Microsoft technology stacks and Windows Azure cloud platform.
Title: Chief Technology Officer

Name: Bill Ryan
Bio: Bill Ryan is a Principal with Dynamics Four.  He currently focuses on Microsoft CRM and SQL Server Analysis Services. Bill's an 8 time Microsoft MVP.
Title: Principal

Name: Brian Lagunas
Bio:
Brian Lagunas is a Microsoft MVP, a Microsoft Patterns & Practices Champion, an INETA Community Speaker, co-leader of the Boise .Net Developers User Group (NETDUG), board member of Boise Code Camp, and original author of the Extended WPF Toolkit. He is a multi-recipient of the Microsoft Community Contributor Award and can be found speaking at a variety of user groups and code camps around the nation. His talks always involve some form of XAML, such as WPF, Silverlight, and Windows 8, as well as how to build modular applications with Prism.
Brian currently works at Infragistics as a Product Manager for the award winning NetAdvantage for WPF and Silverlight components, and the new NetAdvantage for Windows UI control suite.  This is where he helps build tools that empower developers to quickly and easily build and style dynamic applications with immersive UX and vibrant data visualization in line of business applications, across all XAML platforms.  Prior to working at Infragistics he worked in the construction and engineering industry as a senior software engineer and software solution architect where he specialized in enterprise application development.  Before geeking out, Brian served his country in the United States Army as an infantryman and later served his local community as a deputy sheriff.
In his spare time he authors courses for Pluralsight, blogs about XAML technologies, and hosts XAML TV.  The easiest way to find Brian is on twitter at @BrianLagunas.
Title: Product Manager

Name: Bryan Soltis
Bio: Bryan Soltis is the Directory of Technology & Research for Bit-Wizards Custom Solutions, Inc. in Fort Walton Beach, FL. Bit-Wizards is an innovative custom software engineering and consulting firm specializing in commercial application and professional services. Bryan has over 14 years of experience designing and implementing solutions using Microsoft technologies. Bryan is a MCDP for .NET 4.0/3.5, a Microsoft VTSP for Windows Azure, and has over 2 years of experience working with Microsoft?s Cloud platform.
Title: Director of Technology & Research

Name: Chad Altemose
Bio:
Chad is a designer/developer with a history of building innovative and strategic digital experiences and a passion for helping others do the same.
 
He's worked as a designer and a developer on projects ranging from gestural ui prototypes for Microsoft (Kinect, Surface) to alternate reality games for Hollywood blockbuster films to educational applications and curriculum/course design for web design and development.
 
Chad looks to explore the design of technology interactions and experiences that engage the user in the built world while focusing on ui in architecture and the internet of things we're building and becoming.
Title: Designer/Developer

Name: Clay Grisetti
Bio: My name is Clay Grisetti, I am 26 years old, and I am a Software Analyst. In December of 2011 I received my Bachelor?s degree in Software Engineering from Auburn University. Before graduation I accepted a position with CTS, a consulting firm headquartered in Birmingham, AL that had a young office growing in Atlanta, Georgia. What I have enjoyed about working for my company is the constant exposure to new projects, new technologies, and new people. Seeing something you built being used by others and adding value to their work is very rewarding.
Title: Software Analyst

Name: Cory Loriot
Bio: Mr. Loriot has twelve years of experience as a web and desktop applications developer. He also has five years of expertise providing direct support to the Department of Defense initiatives at Defense Activity for Non-Traditional Education Support (DANTES) and the Air Force Special Operations Command (AFSOC). Mr. Loriot is a strong enterprise application developer using the Microsoft development toolset. He has integrated legacy applications and business processes into SharePoint Portal Server (SPS) 2003 and Microsoft Office SharePoint Server (MOSS) 2007 technologies, as well as SharePoint Server 2010. He also has a solid understanding of database design methodologies and implementation using Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle.
Title: Senior Consultant

Name: Craig Simpson
Bio: Craig is a front-end developer of seven years, currently working on AT&T's HTML5 messaging web app (https://messages.att.net/) and its build process. Before that, he was an Eyewonder developer working on Flash and Flex video advertising for publishers and vendors such as Viacom, ABC, FreeWheel, and Brightcove. He also worked for Kid Chess, an after-school chess program, creating animated cartoons and online chess games for kids, K-5. He's been involved with web development since getting his first Geocities account. Lately, he spends his free development time hacking on his Raspberry Pi with Python.
Title: Senior Front-end Developer

Name: David Green
Bio: David works as a senior software developer for Applied Information Sciences in Raleigh, NC. By day he develops within the Microsoft .NET stack and by night messes around with NoSQL data stores (MongoDB, Neo4J, RavenDB) and any other technology that feeds his addiction for learning. David is active in the technical community as speaker and currently helps run the local .NET Data SIG group for developers who are as passionate about data as he is.
Title: Senior Software Engineer

Name: Devin Rader
Bio: Devin Rader spends his day's extolling the virtues of Twilio (www.twilio.com), the amazingly simple cloud communication platform.  Before that he worked at Infragistics where he focused on delivering great user experiences to developers using their controls. He's done work on all of the .NET platforms, but most recently has been focused on ASP.NET and Silverlight. As a co-founder of the St. Louis .NET User Group, a current board member of the Central New Jersey .NET User Group and a former INETA board member, he's an active supporter of the .NET developer community. He's also the co-author or technical editor of numerous books on .NET including Wrox's Professional Silverlight 4 and Wrox's Professional ASP.NET 4. Follow Devin on Twitter @devinrader
Title: Developer Evangelist

Name: Doug Ware
Bio: Doug Ware is the Founder of Elumenotion. Serving as Managing Partner, he leads the firm's capabilities in training, consulting, client development, and operations. Doug is a highly regarded speaker and author of several popular Microsoft SharePoint training kits. Backed with over 14 years of experience with Microsoft Products, he possesses extensive knowledge of the entire software development lifecycle including: requirements planning, system design, development, quality assurance, and product implementation. Throughout his career, Doug served as a Practice Lead and later as General Manager for Magenic - a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner. During this period the practice gained new Microsoft partner competencies for work with BizTalk, SQL Server Analysis Services, and SharePoint. The firm achieved significant growth in terms of customer base and market penetration. Previous to Magenic, he served as Manager of software development for Digital Insight.
Title: Founder, Managing Partner

Name: Douglas Knudsen
Bio: Douglas Knudsen is currently located in the Atlanta area and is a author, developer, and family man. Douglas has been involved in web based technology development for some fifteen years now. He enjoyed working in the past with Adobe technologies such as Flex, Flash Platform, and ColdFusion as well as working with the surrounding technologies of databases, Java, AJAX, and the like. He is currently involved in web development with HTML5/CSS3 working with Fortune 500 companies as well as startups ranging from T-Mobile to Nasdaq to Pearson Education.
Title: Senior Technical Architect

Name: Drew Miller
Bio: Half ogre and half role-playing game and comic book dork, Drew works at GitHub making and testing software. Before that he made and tested software at Microsoft, including MSDN, CodePlex, ASP.NET MVC, and NuGet.

Name: Gifford Watkins
Bio: "Gifford is one of the most unusual people I've met in technology -- in a good way. Here is a guy who grew up a Nova Scotia lobsterman (he's shared lobster recipes with me) and was educated as a minister...and without shedding either of those identities built a serious tech company about as far geographically from Silicon Valley as you can get. He's won the attention of Microsoft and the U.S. Military. And he's always been willing to share his expertise with me. All in all, Giff is a great story." - Kevin Maney
Title: Founder, CEO (Atlantic Webfitters) DNN Software MVP

Name: Glen Gordon
Bio: Glen is a Technical Architect with AgileThought, a full service application development consultancy. Glen works with clients to design and implement techology solutions following Agile methodologies. Glen is a Certified Scrum Master, and his consulting background spans projects of all different types over the last 20 years. Prior to AgileThought, Glen was a Developer Evangelist with Microsoft, serving the southeast developer community through presentations, events and resources. Glen enjoys working with the community and helping to plan events like Code Camp.
Title: Technical Architect

Name: James Ashley
Bio: James is a Presentation Layer Architect on the Emerging Experiences Team at Razofish, an international digital agency and top 10 in Ad Age's A-List for 2011 and 2012.  He is the co-author of 'Beginning Kinect Programming' published by Apress and a Microsoft MVP. In his day job, James develops high-end interactive kiosks, art installations, and digital out-of-home experiences for the Emerging Experiences Team using Kinect, Pixel Sense, Perceptive Pixel, Leap Motion, Google Glass, Windows Phone 8, Surface and related technologies as they become available.  On his free-time, James likes accounting and providing unsolicited IT assistance to strangers.
Title: Presentation Layer Architect

Name: James Bender
Bio: James is a Developer Evangelist for Telerik and has been involved in software development and architecture for 18 years. He has worked as a developer and architect on everything from small, single-user applications to Enterprise-scale, multi-user systems.  His specialties are .NET development and architecture, TDD, SOA, WCF, Web Development, cloud computing, and agile development methodologies. He is an experienced mentor and author. James is a Microsoft MVP, Chairman of the Central Ohio Day of .NET and former President of the Central Ohio .NET Developers Group.  James's book "Professional Test Driven Development with C#: Developing Real World Applications with TDD" was released in May of 2011. His second book "JavaScript and HTML 5 for Windows 8 Development" will be available soon.
Title: Developer Evangelist

Name: Jeff Ammons
Bio: Jeff is president of the Gwinnett, Georgia, Microsoft User Group (http://ggmug.com) and has been developing software for a long time. In addition to developing all kinds of software ranging from web to database to mobile, he has devoted much time to preparing for the inevitable zombie apocalypse via such training simulators as Left4Dead and Killing Floor. He can be found on Steam as jeffa00. Actually he can be found many places as jeffa00... Jeff also occasionally makes silly videos, comics, and essays on his site Galactic Beacon.
CompanyName: Black Book aka National Auto Research
Title: Senior Software Engineer

Name: Jim Wooley
Bio: By date, Jim Wooley is a consultant for Slalom Consulting, In his free time, Jim is a frequent speaker, INETA Regional Speaker, MVP, and author of "LINQ in Action". He is always striving to stay at the forefront of technology and enjoys the thrill of a new challenge. He has been active evangelizing LINQ since it's announcement in 2005. In addition, he attempts to pass on the insights he has gained by being active in the community, including organizing and speaking at code camps and regional events, including DevLink, DevWeek, CodeMash, CodeStock, VS Live, and MIX.
Title: Consultant

Name: Joe Brinkman
Bio: Joe Brinkman started his programming career over 25 years ago while still in high-school and has never looked back.  Prior to co-founding DotNetNuke Corp, he served as CTO for DataSource Inc. where he led the effort for building an automation framework for working with Java J2EE.  As one of the original DotNetNuke core team members, Joe has spent the last 10 years helping to build and promote the #1 CMS for the Windows platform. Joe has co-authored multiple best-selling books for DotNetNuke and jQuery and is a frequent speaker at conferences and user groups.  When not working at the computer you can often find Joe in his woodshop working on his latest woodturning project.
Title: Co-Founder and Technical Fellow

Name: John Papa
Bio: John Papa is a well-known technology expert and is a former Sr Technical Evangelist for Microsoft on the Silverlight, Windows Phone and Windows 8 client teams. John is a Microsoft Regional Director and author of 100+ articles and 10 books, specializes in professional application development with technologies including Windows, HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Silverlight, WPF, C#, .NET and SQL Server. He can often be found speaking around the world at keynotes and sessions for conferences such as Build, MIX, PDC, TechEd, VSLive and AngleBrackets. John was the host of the popular show Silverlight TV on Channel 9 and hosted many events including the MIXer and Open Source Fest at major conferences. He currently enjoys authoring courses for Pluralsight. You can always find John at johnpapa.net or on twitter at @john_papa.
Title: Principal

Name: Jonathan Marbutt
Bio: Jonathan is a passionate developer who is involved as speaker, author, technical editor and consultant. Jonathan has helped many development teams improve their User Experience. Jonathan has co-authored two books, Professional Visual Basic 2012 published by Wrox  & Windows Phone 7 Cookbook published by Packt. He has spoke over the southeast on topics ranging from .Net, Azure, Silverlight and much more.
Title: President

Name: Joseph Feser
Bio:
With over 14 years of experience with Microsoft technologies, I has worked on a vast array of challenging projects. I work at Logical Advantage on a wide array of technologies including Html5, Knockout.js, Silverlight, and Sql Server.

In 2008, I moved to Greenville SC from Cleveland OH to work for NCover. Since then, I have worked on a free timing profiler and many open source projects.

I also spend a lot of time working with Windows Azure using the Service Bus, Sql and Compute technologies.

Name: Keith La Force
Bio:
Keith is currently working at Skookum Digital Works in Charlotte, North Carolina.  
SDW is a technically diverse bunch of engineers who match the best, progressive, open source knowledge to legacy and enterprise software and hardware systems.  He has been working on web applications for almost eight years and is generally language agnostic.  In addition, he has a masters degree in business and is always looking for methods to apply his work in application development to business problems or vice versa.  In addition, Keith is very interested in promoting the open source community in the .NET ecosystem and is currently involved on a few open source projects.
Title: Software Developer

Name: Kelvin McDaniel
Bio: Kelvin is a Tampa-based, Senior  Developer at Agilethought, Inc. He graduated with an MBA from Florida A&M University in 2000 and has experienced a range of fields including insurance and finance. He?s had a love for the various mobile flavors of Windows since the early CE days. He acquired his first Windows-based PDA (a Philips Nino) in 1998 while working in New York City. His favorite response to "Tell us a little bit about yourself"? "Yeah? let me get back to you on that."
Title: Senior Developer

Name: Kris Giorgetti
Bio: Kris is currently a Senior Manager for Daugherty Business Solution where he manages a multi-million dollar portfolio of projects for The Home Depot. He started his career at IBM in 1993 and has over 19-years total experience in information technology management, business development, complex project/program management, software development management, Agile project management, and more. Prior to Daugherty, Kris was the Director of Software Development for CODE Consulting which is the consulting division of CODE Magazine the largest independent software development magazine in the world. Kris has also managed multiple start-up .COM businesses serving as the Director of Information Technology and CEO. Kris majored in Computer Science and Management Psychology at the University of South Florida, and is a Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer, and Certified Scrum Master.
Title: Senior Manager

Name: Mark Rowe
Bio:
Mark Rowe is the founder of MicrosoftPla.net a not-for-profit company focused on volunteer work for the community and society at large.

Mark was on the Board of directors for INETA, a local speaker to Atlanta and a father of 3. Mark also helps run the Microsoft Integration Architect user groups, is on the Six Sense developer team and is a beta developer for Leap. Furthermore, his expertise around the integration stack got him an honorary vTSP title with Microsoft, which was left behind with his consulting career.

During the day, Mark is one of the Lead developers for DocAuto a Document management firm, bringing together some of Atlanta's best to work for some of Atlanta's brightest.
Title: Lead Developer

Name: Mark Wilson
Bio:
Software craftsman, consultant and agile .NET/JavaScript web developer. User group leader and event planner. Loving husband, dog foster, and Disney aficionado. Mark?s focus is on building applications that help?not hinder?people. After all, computers are overly complicated and generally unfriendly enough. Let?s strive to make things better. 

As a Senior .NET Developer at Logical Advantage (www.logicaladvantage.com) in Charlotte, NC, Mark specializes in web software development using HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3 and the Microsoft .NET Framework including C#, ASP.NET MVC, and SQL Server. He is experienced in all phases of software development process including class abstraction, data structures, work flow, and user experience. A self-motivated, energetic team leader with exceptional focus on customer service and satisfaction by delivering specialized products and services that support clients? custom needs in Business Process Management/Automation and Business Intelligence.

Mark lives with his wife and a house full of dogs, most of them being foster dogs. His hobbies include helping his wife with her non-profit animal rescue organization, promoting the development community, and everything that?s Disney. Learn more about Mark at www.coderbits.com/DeveloperInfra or follow him on Twitter @DeveloperInfra.
Title: Senior .NET Developer

Name: Matthew D. Groves
Bio: Matthew D. Groves is a guy who loves to code.  It doesn't matter if it's "enterprisey" C# apps, cool jQuery stuff, contributing to OSS, or rolling up his sleeves to dig into some PHP.  He has been coding professionally ever since he wrote a QuickBASIC point-of-sale app for his parent's pizza shop back in the 90s.  He currently works from home on the Telligent product team, and loves spending time with his wife and 2 kids, watching the Cincinnati Reds, and getting involved in the developer community.  He is the author of AOP in .NET (published by Manning), and also teaches at Capital University in Columbus, Ohio.
Title: Software Developer

Name: Michael Crump
Bio: Michael Crump is a Microsoft MVP, INETA Community Champion, and an author of several .NET Framework eBooks. He speaks at a variety of conferences and has written dozens of articles on .NET development. He currently works at Telerik with a focus on our XAML and mobile control suites.
Title: Mobile Evangelist

Name: Mike Clement
Bio: I'm a husband, father of four and currently a Senior Software Craftsman at Pluralsight. I've worked at Ancestry.com, Microsoft, Caselle and a few other small companies. I am a founding member and organizer of the Utah Software Craftsmanship group (http://utahsc.org). I blog at http://blog.softwareontheside.com/ and you can find me on twitter at @mdclement.
Title: Software Craftsman

Name: Mitch Gordon
Bio: Mitch has worked in many industries and has a wide and varied set of experience.  Industries include manufacturing, retail, transportation, insurance, medical, law, phone center management and marketing.  He has worked with applications using technologies ranging from middleware services to web sites and services to client applications.  Current technologies that interest him are HTML5, TypeScript,  NoSQL and natural language processing.
Title: Lead Consultant

Name: Nigel Alford
Bio: Front-End GIS Web Developer, that loves all things web, development, and mapping.  Nigel Alford is the lead Javascript developer, for the Enterprise GIS team of Norfolk Southern.  A certified Microsoft C# programmer, his main goal and passion is pushing javascript development forward in the Enterprise and web.  Nigel is currently building and implementing an internal javascript API as a mapping platform for internal business usage.  Outside of the Enterprise, Nigel develops on the Wordpress platform as a webmaster and blogger.  Newly launched, Bleu Green Creatives LLC, is Nigel's first venture into private development.
Title: Front-End Developer

Name: Peter Mourfield
Bio: Peter Mourfield has been developing software for nearly 20 years and currently works for TaxSlayer.com, an online income tax preparation web site. Peter leads the Augusta Developers Guild, is an ASP Insider, and holds a number of certifications including; Microsoft Certified Professional Developer (MCPD) in Web Development and a Certified SCRUM Master.

Name: Richard Goforth
Bio: Richard Goforth has enjoyed programming since his youth with Commodore Basic and TI Graphing Calculator Games.  Upon Graduating NC State for Computer Science he entered the world of software development on the Microsoft stack.  He is pretty sure that he has some Microsoft certifications that he was told were very valuable.  Working with Magenic Technologies since 2011, he seeks to continually learn and broaden his software development horizons from the database to the user experience.  He says that his talks are all really interesting, but I wouldn?t take his word for it.
Title: Senior Consultant

Name: Rico Harley
Bio:
Rico Harley is in his first year as an instructor at the Art Institute. Professor Harley brings with him over ten years of experience in management and marketing. Rico is a graduate of Valdosta State University, where he received a B.A. in Marketing in 2002.
 In 2009, he received a Master in Managing Information Systems from Troy University, and in 2012 he became a certified Web Design Specialist. Rico is a self-taught Interactive designer who is fluent in all areas of digital design. At the Art Institute, Professor Harley?s area of expertise include Advanced Web Scripting, JavaScript, and Information Architecture & Design.  Rico believes whole heartedly in the Art Institutes mantra of "Creating Tomorrow".   Rico would like his students to know that "Design is philosophy, but philosophy is not design".

Name: Robert Cain
Bio: Robert C. Cain (http://arcanecode.com) is a Microsoft MVP in SQL Server, MCTS Certified in BI, and works as a Senior Consultant for Pragmatic Works. He is also a technical contributor to Plurasight Training, and co-author of 4 books. A popular speaker, Robert has presented at events such as the SQL PASS Summit, TechEd, SQL Rally, and numerous SQL Saturdays. Robert has over 25 years? experience in the IT industry, working in a variety of fields ranging from manufacturing to telecommunications to nuclear power.
Title: Sr BI Consultant

Name: Roger Peters
Bio: Roger Peters is an independent mobile developer focused on cross-platform apps and games on iOS, Android, Windows 8, Windows Phone, and Kindle Fire. Roger has been a .Net developer for around 10 years and is a former Silverlight MVP, but now focuses entirely on mobile and tablet apps and games. Roger has his own micro-consultancy, All Mobile Everything, and maintains a coding blog at SmartyPantsCoding.com. You can also find out more about Roger at SmartyP.net.
Title: Mobile developer and consultant

Name: Russell Fair
Bio: Russell is the Lead Developer at Cheri Media and has a passion for open source applications. He began developing websites in the late 90?s and started working in IT full time after attending Webster University in St. Louis. His experience includes creating websites and applications for political and community organizations as well as businesses from enterprise to startups. Russell develops WordPress themes and plug-ins and has presented at numerous industry events. He also helps organize WordCamp Atlanta, an annual conference dedicated to WordPress in Atlanta.
Title: Lead Developer

Name: Russell Fustino
Bio: Russ Fustino heads up Developer Evangelism at ComponentOne as a Senior Developer Evangelist.  He is a highly experienced Windows Phone and Windows 8 software developer with a passion for conveying relevant, current, and future software development technologies and tools through live seminars, teaching, and internet video productions.  Russ has a new innovative blog and interview video series with influentials, about current technology, ComponentOne products and developer community called ?Russ Cam?!  Check it out at http://www.componentone.com/russcam  ? He has enlightened, entertained and educated over 1 million developers nationwide and has won the INETA Lifetime Achievement award. He is a former Developer Evangelist for Microsoft.  Follow @RussCamTV and subscribe to his Daily News at http://russcam.comonpentone.com
Title: Head of Developer Evangelism

Name: Sergey Barskiy
Bio: Sergey Barskiy is an architect with Tyler Technologies. He is a Microsoft MVP.  He holds the following certifications: MCPD, MCTS, MCSD for .NET, MCAD for .NET, MCDBA, MCP. He has been working with Microsoft technologies for 15 years.  He is a frequent speaker at various regional and national conferences, such as VS Live, DevLink, CodeStock, and Atlanta Code Camp as well as local user groups.  He is one of the organizers of Atlanta Code Camp and Atlanta Windows Apps users group.  He is also INETA membership mentor for the state of GA.
Title: Architect

Name: Shanon Clemmons
Bio: Shanon works as a Consultant for Computer Technology Solutions in Atlanta Georgia. CTS is a proven IT Consulting Firm and Microsoft National Systems Integrator here in the Southeast. He is currently focused on delivering enterprise level applications and improving DevOps for several companies around the Atlanta area. After Serving in the United States Army, Shanon earned a Bachelor and Master Degrees in Computer Science from the University of South Alabama.
Title: Consultant

Name: Shawn Johnson
Bio: A mobile developer with extensive experience in the industry. In 2000, I developed my first mobile app and continue to assist and influence clients to create mobile apps to boost company visibility in a fun and interactive way. When I am not implementing my own mobile app designs I mentor aspiring mobile developers to become successful in the industry.
Title: Consultant

Name: Shawn Wildermuth
Bio: Shawn Wildermuth is a ten-time Microsoft MVP (ASP.NET/IIS) and is involved with Microsoft as a Data Insider and ASP.NET Insider. You may have taken one of his many courses on Pluralsight including "JavaScript for C# Developers" or "A Better CSS: LESS and SASS". He is also the author of eight books and dozens of articles on software development. He has been seen speaking at a variety of international conferences including TechEd, Oredev, SDC, VSLive, WinDev, MIX, DevTeach, DevConnections and DevReach. He is one of the Wilder Minds at http://wilderminds.com.  He can also be reached via his blog at http://wildermuth.com.
Title: President

Name: Stephen Thomas
Bio: Front end architect with extensive experience in modern web development and a passion for delivering exceptional user experiences. Grounded in the ethnographic foundations of usability and human computer interaction with a deep understanding of front end development based on the principles of accessibility, progressive enhancement and responsive design. Introduced and tutored development teams in the adoption of leading front end technologies such as MV* frameworks and test-driven development. Work experience includes corporate enterprises and service providers, as well as charitable support of non-profit organizations including the Centers for Disease Control and the World Health Organization.

Name: Steven Vore
Bio:
Steven Vore is a Test Studio Evangelist at Telerik, currently working from his home office in Atlanta, Georgia. He has worked in software support and testing for the better part of two decades, and enjoys exploring ways to make software easier to use. Steven has worked on projects in defense contracting, networking software, telephony and medical information.
Steven has a degree in Information Systems Management from the University of Maryland and has earned several technical and project management certifications.
Title: Test Studio Evangelist

Name: Tara Walker
Bio:
Tara E. Walker is a Technical Evangelist in Microsoft?s Developer and Platform Evangelism group.  She has been with Microsoft for 10+ years and is currently based in Atlanta, GA working with software engineers, developers, and students across the Greater Southeast area.   Prior to joining Microsoft, Tara spent 9 years working as a Software Engineer/Developer working with companies like Bellsouth Telecommunications, Time Warner/Turner Broadcasting, and Georgia Pacific on development projects on varying platforms including Unix, Linux, as well as, Microsoft using a variety of programming languages.   
As a Technical Evangelist, Tara spreads the "good word" about all things development and software engineering.  Currently, she is focusing on helping programmers and developers build tablet, mobile, and cross-platform applications with Microsoft technologies and languages. She has been featured in several online and print news articles for her work with students and minorities around Imagine Cup and various technology development initiatives.
Recently, her technical focus development area has been with Windows 8 and Cross-Platform App and Game development, however she leverages her knowledge around Windows Phone 8, Kinect, and Azure Mobile Services when engaging with developers. Tara?s self-imposed goal is to help developers, professional and student alike, realize they don?t have to just be a consumer of technology they can make new technology for us all.
Title: Technical Evangelist

Name: Tejas Patel
Bio: Tejas Patel is Analytics Architect. He designs/ develops machine learning/ predictive analytics/ data-mining solutions for various branding channels such as Rich Media Ads, Social Marketing, Social Gaming and Mobiles.
Title: Analytics Architect

Name: Teo Lachev
Bio: Teo Lachev is a consultant, author, and mentor, with a focus on Microsoft Business Intelligence. His Atlanta-based company Prologika helps organizations make sense of data by applying effectively Microsoft Business Intelligence technologies for reporting, analysis, and data mining. Teo has authored and co-authored several SQL Server Business Intelligence books. He speaks frequently at industry conferences, including Tech Ed and local groups, and leads the Microsoft Business Intelligence Group in Atlanta. Microsoft has recognized Teo's experience in Business Intelligence and contributions to the technical community by awarding him the Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) status for nine years.
Title: President

Name: TJ Bakre
Bio: Passionate developer interested in learning more about compilers and hoping to build my pet programming language some day.

Name: Tom Fuller
Bio: Over the past 10+ years in software I?ve done a variety of different things. I am proud to say I broke into the industry as a web master hacking away at Web design and development for a software company and most recently I?ve been working as an Azure Technology Specialist for Microsoft. There was also a brief stint in there as a corporate software architect and Microsoft MVP but those are ancient history now.
Title: Windows Azure Technology Specialist

Name: Wael Kdouh
Bio: Wael is a Senior Consultant with Magenic Technologies. He has over twelve years of programming experience that he accumulated while pursuing his PhD in Computer Science, being a teaching assistant, and ultimately a Software Engineer in leading software companies.
Title: Senior Consultant

Name: Wally McClure
Bio: Wally McClure graduated from the Georgia Tech with a BS & MS in Electrical Engineering. Since that time, he has done consulting and development for companies large and small. Wally has authored books on iPhone Programming with Xamarin.iOS, Xamarin.Android, application architecture, ADO.NET & SQL Server, and finally AJAX. He is a Microsoft MVP and an ASPInsider, and a partner in Scalable Development, Inc., where we're ramping up to provide training on Monotouch and Mono for Android.

Name: William Fink
Bio: I?m a technologist, consultant, speaker, and coach. My passion is technology and helping people solve problems utilizing the latest tools and techniques in the field of information technology.  When I am not at work writing code, I am at home writing code (or thinking about code). Sometimes I write code in my sleep.
Title: Consultant and Training Cordinator

Name: Yair Segal
Bio:
Yair has being coding since 2nd grade in Basic. For the past 10 years Yair has being developing web and mobile applications using C# and C++. As a passionate coder you can often find him coding at 4AM on weekends. He has a bachelor in electrical engineering from Georgia Tech. In 2008 after moving into a manager position Yair started Peach Software Inc. to provide residual income (Motorcycle Money) and keep his coding skills up to date. Since 2010 he is the chief software architect and CEO of Peach Software Inc.
In addition to his work, Yair is a regular contributor/sponsor to several local tech events and conferences. In his free time Yair likes to ride his motorcycle, play basketball, cross fit training, and obstacle racing. He currently resides in Polo MO with his wife, 2 kids, and 2 large mastiff dogs. He can be reached at: ysegal@mypeachsoftware.com
Title: Chief Software Architect

Name: Allan Davis
Bio: With a passion for Mobile Development, Allan Davis has been focused on native development for iOS and Android for the past couple of years.   Allan began his career in 1996 while learning basic programming.  Feeling the urge to delve deeper, Allan became certified in Java as a developer and along the way was instrumental in development of Python with NetBeans.  He honed his talents with Objective C, and Ruby on Rails.  Allan has long been driven to share his knowledge and offers several classes each year in Mobile and Web Development and has an online video series for Android, iOS and Ruby on Rails applications.
Title: Founder

Name: Ben Alexander
Bio: With more than 15 years of experience in supporting PMG customers, Ben leads the product management of the PMG Enterprise Service Catalog. Working directly with customers to understand their needs and challenges, he sets the vision for the roadmap, and ensures the execution to deliver to a superior industry product to customers.
Title: Director Product Management

Name: Candace Ramsey-Blackburn
Bio: Candace has 18 years of experience in IT.  She has worked as a manager of IT for 10 of those 18 years implementing enterprise infrastructure and strategy for her organization.  She has an MBA and MS in Software Engineering and has currently been helping her company implement Agile and Scrum for the first time.
Title: Software Engineer/Project Manager/Scrum Master

Name: Chris G. Williams
Bio:
Chris G. Williams wears ALL the hats at Big Robot Games. He is the creator of the Charity Fragathon and Magenic Code Mastery events, lead speaker on the Tour de Awesome, founder of several .NET User Groups and the author of Professional Windows Phone 7 Game Development along with numerous Code Magazine articles.

He's also a 9 year multi-disciplinary Microsoft MVP, MCT, MCSD, indie game developer, Bitcoin enthusiast, creator & maintainer of the open source Heroic Adventure! project, creator & maintainer of the open source CryptoConnector project, INETA Community Champion & 4 year Board of Directors member.
Title: I am the Big Robot

Name: Chris Love
Bio: Chris has over 20 years, yes that's right, of web development experience. He has built a wide variety of web sites and applications in those years. In recent years he has begun to immerse himself in the modern, single page web application space. This has giving him some amazing experiences using HTML5, JavaScript, CSS and responsive design. Currently he is obsessed with modern web and mobility to help solve the problems many enterprises are having adapting to the rapidly changing technology landscape. He has authored 3 books, including his latest, High Performance Single Page Web Applications,http://amzn.to/1b0twcm. He is a 7 time ASP.NET MVP, ASP Insider and Internet Explorer User Agent. Chris regularly speaks at user groups, code camps and other developer events. He Blogs athttp://love2dev.com.

Name: Chris Miller
Bio: Chris is a Microsoft MVP, a Xamarin Certified Mobile Developer for iOS and Android, and leads the Tech Valley .NET User Group in Albany NY. He has been developing on various platforms for too long to detail, but he currently works with and writes about C# programming using Microsoft and Xamarin tools. Chris works for Tyler Technologies, designing and implementing student transportation management applications for the K-12 market. You can follow Chris on Twitter @anotherlab.
Title: Senior R&D Engineer

Name: Chris Morrow
Bio:
I'm a Senior UI Developer at Soltech, Inc. I've worked in the web development field for over 16 years. I've used a number of web technologies including Flash, Flex, Javascript, jQuery, Require JS, NodeJS , Knockout JS, Angular JS, Sass/CSS, and HTML5. Throughout my career I have maintained focus on the UI and the user experience. I enjoy web design, but have accepted my talents are more code-centric.
I began my career as a Flash developer in 1998 (don't hate me). I love to share what I've learned with others, and I'm always open to learning from others and being told that I'm wrong. I've worked with a number of enterprises including IBM, Georgia-Pacific, and IHG. I've also worked for digital marketing agencies with clients including Home Depot, NYSE, The NBA, Georgia Lottery, Graco, Americas Mart, BeautyRest, and Accu-Chek.
When I'm not coding I enjoy tennis, a good craft beer, or hanging out with my wonderful wife and two kids.

Name: Chris Schaich
Bio: Chris Schaich is a Senior Consultant for RDA Corporation with more than 20 years of experience designing and building enterprise solutions with Microsoft technologies.
Title: Senior Consultant

Name: Cory Loriot
Bio: Mr. Loriot has twelve years of experience as a web and desktop applications developer. He also has five years of expertise providing direct support to the Department of Defense initiatives at Defense Activity for Non-Traditional Education Support (DANTES) and the Air Force Special Operations Command (AFSOC). Mr. Loriot is a strong enterprise application developer using the Microsoft development toolset. He has integrated legacy applications and business processes into SharePoint Portal Server (SPS) 2003 and Microsoft Office SharePoint Server (MOSS) 2007 technologies, as well as SharePoint Server 2010. He also has a solid understanding of database design methodologies and implementation using Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle.
Title: Senior Consultant

Name: Danny Fafach
Bio: Danny Fafach is passionate about architecting systems to communicate with each other organically. He believes that healthy system communication is a crucial ingredient in any industry-leading organization today. Danny is from Boulder, Colorado and has been consulting with CTS for over 5 years.
Title: Senior Consultant / Architect

Name: Darlene Hancock
Bio:
25 years experience in Software Development. Applications include seismic data analysis, real-time traffic control systems, user interface design, database management systems, and architectural diagrams and reports. 

Consultant to Ebay?s CTO on Architecture and Scalability.

Consultant to David Kelley, a Stanford professor who teaches graduate level Design Methodology and founder of IDEO . Mr. Kelley worked directly for Steve Jobs and has been recognized as one of America?s top design innovators.

Managed and mentored software developers in Object-Oriented Design Methodologies. Authored a course on Object-Oriented Design Methodology.

Managed multi-million dollar software projects.
Title: VP Marketing/ Chief Architect

Name: Darrel Miller
Bio: Darrel has been building distributed business applications on the Microsoft platform for more than 20 years. He is an active member of the .NET community and OSS contributor. When he?s not reading IETF specifications in order to answer Stack Overflow questions, or writing tooling to help people build hypermedia driven client applications, you will find him enjoying time with his wife and daughter in Montreal, Quebec. Darrel works as a developer advocate at Runscope ensuring the best support possible to .NET developers who are building and consuming Web APIs. Darrel has been a long time member of the Microsoft Web API advisory board, a Microsoft Integration MVP and recently co-authored the O'Reilly book, Designing Evolvable Web APIs with ASP.NET.
Title: Developer Advocate

Name: David Neal
Bio: David is a husband, father, geek, musician, motorcyclist, speaker, and software developer living near Chattanooga, TN. He's currently a Developer Advocate for LeanKit, makers of LeanKit Kanban, an enterprise visual project management tool. David served as president of the Nashville .NET User Group for 2012 and 2013. He is also a high-volume consumer of caffeine and bacon.
Title: Developer Advocate

Name: Douglas Knudsen
Bio: As a Solutions Architect, Douglas brings over fifteen years of building highly visible solutions in the enterprise and consumer spaces spanning financial institutions such as Nasdaq to educational stalwarts like Pearson to technology giants like RIM. Douglas is currently focused at delivering mobile solutions on the Android platform as well as working with the vast HTML5 based technological arena. Douglas' background in Mathematics is probably fueling his recent interest in Big Data.  In his off hours, you can find Douglas speaking at local user groups on technology in the Atlanta area when not tutoring his kids in fun Mathematics topics.
Title: Solutions Architect

Name: Gaines Kergosien
Bio: Gaines Kergosien is a senior solutions architect with Vanick Digital, serves as a board member for the Nashville .NET User Group, and speaks at software development conferences throughout the United States. With over 12 years in solutions development using Microsoft technologies, his work includes consulting for such companies as Bridgestone, Deloitte, Hospital Corporation of America (HCA), American General (AIG), Lexis Nexis, Gibson Guitars, and Cardinal Healthcare.
Title: Senior Solutions Architect

Name: Glen Gordon
Bio: Glen Gordon is a Technical Architect and Azure practice champion for AgileThought. He works with clients to architect and design custom software solutions using agile methodologies. Prior to joining AgileThought, Glen was a Technical Evangelist with Microsoft for 8 years, spreading the word about their software offerings and programs, and speaking at various community events. He is passionate about the expanding landscape of software and services ? from mobile devices to cloud computing to improving the process of software development itself. Glen graduated from Georgia Tech, and his consulting and technology experience spans over 20 years. Glen lives in the Atlanta area with his 3 children.
Title: Technical Architect

Name: Innocent Djiofack
Bio: Innocent is a 6 years experience Microsoft Certified Professional Developer specialized in C#. Before he got to know Visual studio, he was writing code in C, C++ and java. If you really want to get him talk introduce topics related to business strategies for the IT industry and software architecture.
Title: Research Assistant

Name: J. Dan Attis
Bio:
J. Dan Attis is the founder of the Atlanta SharePoint User Group and has been a staple in the local .NET and SharePoint communities since the days of SharePoint 2003. He has been working exclusively with SharePoint since 2005 and is an 8 time SharePoint MVP. His IT career began in 1999 when he first moved to the United States from Canada after being recruited by an international consulting firm. After getting settled in, he started putting in his time (roughly 10 years) at various local firms, including Definition 6, Intellinet, and Slalom Consulting. His current employer, B&R Business Solutions, is a New Jersey based consulting company with a deep focus on SharePoint. Dan's specialty is custom development, but he has been seen working in many other areas, including product development, architecture, project management and business analysis to name a few.

When not sitting in front of his many monitors in his home office, coding away like a madman, he enjoys spending time with his exceptionally awesome and beautiful daughter Lily and gallivanting around the globe (mostly just back to Canada) to visit and spend time with his stunning fianc Gillian.

You can find Dan moderating or speaking at the monthly meeting of the Atlanta SharePoint User Group (@atlspug, #atlspug), online via Twitter (@jdattis), LinkedIn (www.linkedin.com/in/jakedanattis/), at a SharePoint Conference or SharePoint Saturday, or on Skype (jdattis).

Dan lives in Roswell, Georgia, where the sun is hot and his [cool weather] fescue lawn is both his love and his evil nemesis.
Title: Senior SharePoint Solution Architect

Name: James Ashley
Bio: James Ashley is a Microsoft MVP in the Kinect for Windows program and also the author of Beginning Kinect Programming published by Apress.  He is currently finishing a new book on the Kinect for Windows v2 which encapsulates some of what he has learned about emerging technologies over the past four years working with Kinect, Oculus Rift, Arduino, Netduino, Perceptive Pixel, Google Glass, and Leap Motion.  He is effectively a professional hand waver, and makes a good living doing it.  By night, he puts on a mask and fights crime.
Title: Solutions Architect

Name: Jay Hill
Bio:
Jay is a software development consultant focused on the craft of coding, from developer productivity practices to the disciplines that yield quality code. He currently works on real-time securities trading applications, seeking to bring simple, elegant user experience design to the world of financial software.

Jay organizes community events and supports computer science initiatives in primary education.
Title: Software Development Consultant

Name: Jeff Ammons
Bio:
Jeff runs the Gwinnett, Georgia, Microsoft User Group (http://www.meetup.com/Gwinnett-Microsoft-Users-Group/) which meets the second Thursday of each month at Gwinnett Technical College.

He enjoys learning about new technology and sharing what he has learned. His one absolute rule is that he never speaks of himself in the third person.

Name: Jeremy Duvall
Bio: Jeremy, a software architect who possesses a fascination with algorithms and design patterns, works for Slalom Consulting, and specializes in the design and implementation of scalable, performant, and maintainable enterprise applications. These products are built through his lens of a healthy respect for compiler technology as well as research focusing in software quality. He recently returned to his alma mater, Georgia Institute of Technology, to receive a Masters Degree in Computer Science with a specialty in software engineering and database design.
Title: Solution Architect

Name: Jeremy Likness
Bio: Jeremy Likness is a principal architect within the custom application development practice at Atlanta-based iVision. During Jeremy?s 20 years of experience working on enterprise applications (with 15 of those years focused on web-based apps) he has helped several initially small companies like Manhattan Associates and AirWatch grow and has actively participated in their transition from good to great. Jeremy is a 5-year Microsoft MVP for Windows Platform Development, has authored and co-authored four technology books and regularly speaks at events around the country. Once upon a time he even dreamed of becoming a game developer and wrote/co-wrote several customized and one total conversion for Quake. In his free time Jeremy loves to spend time with his daughter supporting her healthy cooking business, watching retro sci-fi movies and teaching her to drive. A former certified fitness trainer and specialist in nutrition, he is currently training his wife to walk her first marathon after undergoing major back surgery. Jeremy?s personal mission is to transform the lives of other developers in appreciation for how the industry has impacted his own life.
Title: Principal Architect

Name: Jesse Riley
Bio: Starting out as a .net developer, now living in northern Atlanta, you'll find him speaking on a wide variety of tech topics ... sometimes even in public! Jesse's been in technology since high school and writing software in various capacities for about the last 7 years and almost all of them using agile methodology. When he's not writing software in a variety of languages or building a new box, he's probably working on his cars, house, or something he probably shouldn't be.
Title: Technical Coach/Developer

Name: Jim Wooley
Bio: By day, Jim Wooley is a consultant for Slalom Consulting, In his free time, Jim is a frequent speaker, INETA Regional Speaker, MVP, and author of "LINQ in Action". He is always striving to stay at the forefront of technology and enjoys the thrill of a new challenge. He has been active evangelizing LINQ since it's announcement in 2005. In addition, he attempts to pass on the insights he has gained by being active in the community, including organizing and speaking at code camps and regional events, including DevLink, DevWeek, CodeMash, CodeStock, VS Live, and MIX.
Title: Solution Architect

Name: John Garland
Bio: John Garland is a Principal Consultant at Wintellect and a Windows Platform Development MVP. Prior to consulting, John spent much of his career working on high-performance video and statistical analysis tools for premier sports teams, with an emphasis on the NFL, the NBA, and Division 1 NCAA Football and Basketball. His consulting clients range from small businesses to Fortune-500 companies and his work has been featured at Microsoft conference keynotes and sessions. John and his family have recently relocated to Atlanta from New Hampshire where he had been an active participant in the New England development community. He is a graduate of the University of Florida with a Bachelor?s degree in Computer Engineering. John is the author of the book "Windows Store Apps Succinctly" and co-author of the book "Programming the Windows Runtime by Example" with Jeremy Likness. He is a member of Microsoft?s Azure Insiders group, as well as a member of the Azure Mobile Services Advisory Board.
Title: Principal Consultant

Name: John Repko
Bio: John Repko is a Senior Project Manager for RDA Corporation with significant management and technical experience. He aggressively implements solutions that increase productivity, cut costs, and boost revenues. He is an experienced lead strategist in managing the business functions of an organization as well as all phases of enterprise-wide technology rollouts. John has over 28 years of experience as an architect and developer of enterprise solutions. Coupled with extensive project and team management skills, he has a long and successful track record of delivering solutions on time and under budget.
Title: Senior Project Manager

Name: Jonathan Johnson
Bio: Jonathan Johnson is a Technical Architect at SolTech, Inc. He is passionate about leveraging Amazon Web Services to run the custom applications SolTech builds. Jonathan has helped build and deploy numerous applications to AWS and enjoys deciphering the AWS "TLAs".
Title: Technical Architect

Name: Joseph Feser
Bio: With over 16 years of experience with Microsoft technologies, I has worked on a vast array of challenging projects. I work at Logical Advantage on a wide array of technologies including Html5, Knockout.js, Silverlight, and Sql Server. In 2008, I moved to Greenville SC from Cleveland OH to work for NCover. Since then, I have worked on a free timing profiler and many open source projects. I also spend a lot of time working with Windows Azure using the Service Bus, Sql and Compute technologies.
Title: Senior Developer

Name: Josh Lane
Bio: I?m an experienced software practitioner with over 17 years of experience architecting and building high-scale enterprise systems. As Wintellect?s Cloud Practice Lead I?m responsible for expanding our cloud focus across three lines of business: consulting, traditional classroom training, and on-demand video-based training. It?s a great gig; I get to make big decisions with big impact for our company, all while maintaining plenty of reasons to keep Visual Studio installed on my laptop.
Title: Cloud Practice Lead

Name: Mark A. Wilson
Bio:
Software craftsman, consultant and agile .NET/JavaScript web developer. User group leader and event planner. Loving husband, dog foster, and Disney aficionado.

Mark specializes in cloud computing and web application development. Client side languages include HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3. Server side technologies include Microsoft Visual C#, ASP.NET MVC, and SQL Server.

He is a Senior .NET Developer at Logical Advantage (www.logicaladvantage.com) in Charlotte, NC. A self-motivated, energetic team leader able to quickly learn new technologies and tools. Experienced in all phases of the agile software development methodology. Focused on building applications that enhance and help people?not hinder them. Committed to providing the highest level of customer service and satisfaction. Delivers custom Business Process Management/Automation and Business Intelligence products and services.

Mark lives with his wife and a house full of dogs, most of them being foster dogs. Hobbies include helping his wife with her non-profit animal rescue, promoting the development community, and everything Disney. Learn more about Mark at about.me/developerinfra or follow him on Twitter @DeveloperInfra
Title: Senior .NET Developer

Name: Michael Crump
Bio: Michael Crump is a Microsoft MVP, Pluralsight and MSDN author as well as an international speaker. He works at Telerik with a focus on everything mobile. You can reach him on Twitter @mbcrump or keep up with his blog by visiting michaelcrump.net.
Title: Mobile Advocate

Name: Michael Thompson
Bio: Michael Thompson is an software developer in Atlanta with over 10 years experience. Enterprise Web developer on the .Net stack by day, in his off hours he tinkers with other languages and platforms such as Node.js, Ruby, and arduino. He enjoys discussing agile methodologies and the people side of software development with anyone that will listen.
Title: Software Developer

Name: Mick Andrew
Bio:
Mick began his programming career in North London, but was quickly lured to the USA by the promise of more opportunities, higher salaries and better weather.
Since then he has been programming and managing enterprise applications development, initially in Unix and C, dabbled in Java, and finally settled down with .Net ever since it was introduced at the Orlando 2000 PDC. For the past two years he?s been managing Cloud and Web projects for Sage at their corporate campus in Lawrenceville, in north east suburban Atlanta.
Title: Director of Development

Name: Mitch Gordon
Bio: Mitch started his career in technology as a mainframe developer and then moved up through PowerBuilder, VB and .Net. He has had the opportunity to work with many different industries in many different environments. His current passion is for mobile technologies and how mobile platforms can be leveraged to make life easier. Mitch lives on a mountain top outside Atlanta with his wife and daughters and in his free time enjoys recording and producing music in his home studio.
Title: Lead Consultant

Name: Monika Mueller
Bio: Monika Mueller has a long career in IT and business consulting with a practical bent. A leader in the integration of business and technology with hands on experience in delivering solutions in large organizations in a variety of industries and process areas. Proven ability to work closely with business users (from c-level executives to end users) to define and deliver effective solutions to business problems. Innovative problem solver focused on the achievement of business value through the solution. Strong record of success in evolving IT departments and Customer Service Organizations. Title: Delivery Operations Leader

Name: Ozgur Ozturk
Bio:
Ozgur Ozturk is a full stack developer. He worked at companies including Oracle, NCR, SRA, and AirWatch, and is currently at Wolters Kluwer. He received his PhD from the Ohio State University in Computer Science and Engineering. He is a fan of agile methodologies, continuous integration and test driven development.

Title: Technical Architect

Name: Philip Japikse
Bio: An international speaker, Microsoft MVP, ASPInsider, MCSD, CSM, and CSP, and a passionate member of the developer community, Phil Japikse has been working with .NET since the first betas, developing software for over 30 years, and heavily involved in the agile community since 2005. Phil is the Principal Architect for InterKnowlogy (http://www.InterKnowlogy.com), helping an amazing team create high impact software experiences. Phil serves as the Lead Director for the Cincinnati .NET User?s Group and the Cincinnati Software Architect Group, co-hosts the Hallway Conversations podcast (www.hallwayconversations.com), founded the Cincinnati Day of Agile, and volunteers for the National Ski Patrol. You can follow Phil on twitter viawww.twitter.com/skimedic and read his blog atwww.skimedic.com/blog.

Name: Pushkar Chivate

He also has a passion for helping non-profit organizations by helping them develop technical solutions.

Bio: Rick is a Clojure Developer and tech lead at RentPath in Atlanta. Prior to discovering Clojure, Rick was a long time C# and SQL Server developer.

Name: Andrew Fuqua
Bio:
Andrew Fuqua began developing software professionally in the mid '80s using an iterative and incremental approach. After a few years of working in not-so-agile environments, Andrew got iterative and incremental again with a Smalltalk team in '96, and then began using eXtreme Programming in 1999. For the last few years, Andrew has been involved in agile transformations in larger organizations, which brings us to his current role as an Enterprise Transformation Consultant with LeadingAgile. Andrew has previously held positions in management, product management and software development at companies like Internet Security Systems, Allure Global, and IBM. 

Andrew is the president of the Agile Atlanta user group, which he helped start in 2001, as well as the Atlanta Limited WIP Society. He has also been active in other groups around town. Andrew earned a BS and MS in computer science and has an MBA from Duke University.

Name: Andrew Slivker
Bio: Andrew Slivker, Nevatech co-founder and CTO, has spent more than two decades building and managing SOA platforms that bring business capacity to enterprise communications. He designed SOA and API systems that are used around the world and handle billions of transactions per year. A Microsoft technologies veteran with more than 25 years of experience in software architecture and implementations, Andrew Slivker has worked in large enterprise organizations and successful startups. Prior to joining Nevatech he served as a Director of Microsoft Development for SOA Software, and Senior VP of Applications Development for Listman Home Technologies where he designed and orchestrated development of the world's first Microsoft-based SOA implementation of the Universal Plug-and-Play Home Automation system. As a Chief Technology Officer of Nevatech, Andrew Slivker works on the next-generation SOA Governance and API Management solutions with unique focus on support and integration with the Microsoft technology stacks and Microsoft Azure cloud platform.

Name: Dave Baskin
Bio: Dave Baskin is a Senior Consultant at Wintellect -- a recognized leader in mission critical architecture, design and development. Dave has worked on a variety of large, enterprise web applications, in both the Microsoft and Open Source stacks, encompassing front-end development using AngularJS and D3, to back-end web APIs, database. He lives in Tennessee with his wife and family.

Name: John Garland
Bio: John works as a Principal Consultant at Wintellect, and is a Windows Platform Development MVP, a member of Microsoft?s Azure Insiders group, as well as a member of the Azure Mobile Services Advisory Board.  Prior to consulting, John spent much of his career working on high-performance video and statistical analysis tools for premier sports teams, with an emphasis on the NFL, the NBA, and Division 1 NCAA Football and Basketball.  His consulting clients range from small businesses to Fortune-500 companies and his work has been featured at Microsoft conference keynotes and sessions.  John is a graduate of the University of Florida with a Bachelor?s degree in Computer Engineering.  John is the author of the book "Windows Store Apps Succinctly", available through Syncfusion and co-author of the book "Programming the Windows Runtime by Example" with Jeremy Likness.

Name: Mike Clement
Bio: A husband, father of four, and currently a Learning Coach, Chief Curriculum Officer and Co-founder of Greater Sum, Mike Clement believes we work best when we are working together and that there are no best practices?only better and worse ones depending on the context. Passionate about raising the bar of technical excellence in the software development community, Mike is a founding member of the Utah Software Craftsmanship group and an organizer of the Agile Roots conference. He recently moved to the Atlanta area and is excited about joining the community!  He has worked at several companies including Pluralsight, Ancestry.com, Microsoft, and Caselle. Find out more about Mike on his blog (http://blog.softwareontheside.com/) and on Twitter at @mdclement.

Name: Tanya Do
Bio: Tanya Do is a software engineer at Mercer Engineering Research Center, where she works on software for C-130 planes at the Robins Air Force Base. She holds degrees in Computer Science and Economics from Mercer University (Go Bears!) Tanya is a true believer of scrum and agile software development, ardent advocator for clean code, and part-owner of a little terror that takes the form of a cat. When not living in the .NET world, she likes to venture out into the world of Python and data visualization.

Name: Abbey Gwayambadde
Bio: Abbey Gwayambadde is a Solution Architect, Developer, and lover of all Tech. He has worked at Comcast, GM, and Curtis 100. He has spent his professional career designing and developing Polyglot solutions using Microsoft and Java Stacks, and various front-end frameworks such as Angular, Ionic, Cordova, Bootstrap, and Backbone. He is also a lover of IOT, Home Automation, and building bots using Node and JavaScript.

Name: Barry Stahl
Bio:
Barry is a .NET Software Engineer who has been creating business solutions for enterprise customers for more than 25 years. Barry is also an Election Integrity Activist, baseball and hockey fan, husband of one genius and father of another, and a 30 year resident of Phoenix Arizona. When Barry is not traveling around the world to speak at Conferences, Code Camps and User Groups or to participate in GiveCamps, he spends his days as Principal Application Architect for Crew Systems at American Airlines and his nights working on the next Arizona GiveCamp, an annual event where software developers come together to build websites and apps for some great non-profit organizations.

You can follow Barry on Twitter @bsstahl or read his blog at http://www.cognitiveinheritance.com.

Name: David Neal
Bio: David is a family man, geek, musician, motorcyclist, speaker, and software developer living in North GA. He's currently a Developer Advocate for LeanKit. He's a Microsoft MVP, and runs on a high-octane mixture of caffeine and bacon.

Name: Dennis Hayes
Bio: Dennis Hayes has been programming since the early 70?s, split between the Atlanta area and Silicon Valley. He was the open source editor and writer of the Monkey Business column for .NET Developer?s Journal for over six years. He has written numerous pieces for .NET Developer?s Journal, ASP.NET Pro, and iSensors magazines, and LINQ in VB 2008 for APress. He has given presentation to users groups and code camps around the Southeast. He currently spends most of his working time writing .NET code in C# and VB.NET, and looking to transition to HTML5/JS/CSS.

Name: Jeremy Likness
Bio: Jeremy is the director of application development and principal architect at iVision, a technology services company that leverages data center, converged infrastructure, engineering support services, delivery assurance, and application development practices to engineer the future for clients, today. Jeremy wrote his first program in 1982, was recognized in the "who's who in Quake" list for programming the first implementation of "Midnight Capture the Flag" in Quake C and has been developing enterprise applications for 20 years. For the past 15 years he has specialized in web-based delivery of line of business applications. Jeremy is the author of four technology books, a six year Microsoft MVP for Windows Platform Development, a Telerik Kendo UI Developer Expert, and speaks and writes regularly on web-based topics such as AngularJS. Jeremy is vegan and spends most of his free time running, hiking and camping with his family, watching retro science fiction movies with his daughter and playing 9-ball and one pocket.

Name: Keith Rome
Bio: Keith is an Atlanta-based Principal Architect and the Xamarin Practice Lead with Wintellect. He has been involved with regional .NET developer communities since the initial launch of .NET over a decade ago, and has presented on numerous topics over the years and helped organize and manage local user groups and code camps. He is also a former Microsoft MVP (C#) and at various points in his career has been an expert developer/architect in many technologies and platforms.

Name: Nick Harrison
Bio: Nick Harrison is a Software Architect and .NET advocate in Columbia, SC. Nick has over 18 years experience in software developing, starting with Unix system programming and then progressing to the DotNet platform. He is a published author with Simple-Talk, Red Gate, and SyncFusion.    He occasionally even blogs about a wide variety of DotNet topics ranging from UI to the Database and everything in between.

Name: Walt Ritscher
Bio: Walt's enthusiasm for crafting software interfaces blossomed early. Just a few days after discovering how to move pixels around a computer screen he was devouring books on the topic of computer graphics and UI design. Before long he was sharing his discoveries with other technology buffs, a lifelong pursuit that has led to teaching engagements at universities, private training companies and the international conference circuit. He is now a staff author at Lynda.com, part of the LinkedIn family, where his content team produces hundreds of technical training courses for software developers each year. He's been awarded the Microsoft MVP every year since 2005 and is currently a Windows Platform Development MVP.He is a frequent speaker at major industry events in Europe, Asia and the Americas. In an earlier phase of life he was a professional musician, first working jobs as a trombonist, later exploring music with keyboards and synthesizers.

Name: Jim Wooley
Bio: By day, Jim Wooley is a Solution Architect for Slalom Consulting, In his free time, Jim is a frequent speaker, MVP, and author of "LINQ in Action". He is always striving to stay at the forefront of technology and enjoys the thrill of a new challenge. He has been active evangelizing LINQ since its announcement in 2005. In addition, he attempts to pass on the insights he has gained by being active in the community, including organizing and speaking at code camps and regional events, including DevLink, DevWeek, CodeMash, CodeStock, VS Live, and MIX.

Name: Joseph Feser
Bio: With over 17 years of experience with Microsoft technologies, I has worked on a vast array of challenging projects. I work at Logical Advantage on a wide array of technologies including Html5, Knockout.js, Silverlight, and Sql Server. In 2008, I moved to Greenville SC from Cleveland OH to work for NCover. Since then, I have worked on a free timing profiler and many open source projects. I also spend a lot of time working with Windows Azure using the Service Bus, Sql and Compute technologies.

Name: Robert Cain
Bio: Robert C. Cain (http://arcanecode.com) is a Microsoft MVP in SQL Server, MCTS Certified in BI, and works as a Senior Solutions Architect for Pragmatic Works. He is also a technical contributor to Plurasight Training, and co-author of 4 books. A popular speaker, Robert has presented at events such as the SQL PASS Summit, TechEd, CodeStock, and numerous SQL Saturdays. Robert has over 25 years experience in the IT industry, working in a variety of fields ranging from manufacturing to telecommunications to nuclear power.

Name: Shawn Johnson
Bio:
Shawn Johnson is a mobile architect with over 19 years of development experience. He has extensive experience creating mobile solutions for Fortune 500 companies including AT&T, IHG, Coke, HomeDepot.
A thought leader and Subject Matter Expert on all things mobile, Shawn has been teaching mobile development for the last 4 years; His IOS and Android classes and workshops have been attended by hundreds of students. He is a well-regarded participant in the Atlanta tech scene, winning multiple hackathons around the country as well as speaking at local conferences, and meetup sessions. 

Shawn has a passion for teaching and loves introducing others to new technology. He spends his free time mentoring both adults and children. Outside of his work and mentoring, Shawn has a passion for cooking. Calling his kitchen his "Happy Place", he has been known to show up to work and events with his cupcake creations in tow, along with his laptop. Shawn lives in Atlanta with his two daughters.

Name: Stuart Dickerson
Bio: Stuart is a Microsoft Certified Applications Developer (MCAD) for Web Applications.  He currently is a Senior Software Engineer at Unum in Chattanooga.  Stuart?s current focus is the current shift in web development utilizing consumable API?s and JavaScript clients.  He is active in the Chattanooga developer community and serves on the board of the Chattanooga Technology Council.  He also participates in efforts to educate high school kids in technology and web development.

Name: Jeff Ammons
Bio:
Jeff Ammons is a Principal Architect for Sage Software and President of the Gwinnett, Georgia, Microsoft User Group (ggmug.com). He's been working with web technology since before <table> was added to HTML.
You can follow Jeff on Twitter at @jeffa00, read his blog at http://ammonsonline.com and watch his videos at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClX8aPdwI-a08chu41nZWUQ. The truly bored can even see some of his comics and short stories at http://galacticbeacon.com.

Name: Derrick Cawthon
Bio:
Derrick Cawthon is a highly qualified Technical Architect with over 10 years of experience in the technology industry. Derrick is skilled in modern development practices including Agile/Scrum methodologies. Derrick is involved in all areas of the SDLC including planning, development efforts, unit testing, building and deploying to multiple complex environments. Derrick has performed numerous complex TFS migrations going back to TFS 2005 for multiple clients across various industries. Derrick has been performing SCM related activities for clients for the past 8 years. His primary areas of focus lately have been TFS migrations, planning activities, customized build processes and complex multi-domain deployments using Release Management and Powershell. He has also focused on assisting software testers using TFS and automating the testing process for increased efficiency. 

Derrick holds the following certifications: Certified Scrum Master (ScrumAlliance), TFS 12 Administrator (Microsoft) and Certified Ethical Hacker (EC-Council). Derrick is a member of the Microsoft VS ALM Rangers.

Derrick is based in Atlanta GA.

Name: Ian Philpot
Bio: Ian Philpot is a Sr. Technical Evangelist and former engineer at Microsoft who specializes in Azure Development. For the past five years he?s been working with various Product Groups helping to ensure their customers? expectations are exceeded. Ian has been involved with events such as 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, 2014 FIFA world Cup, and most recently the Super Bowl XLIX. Ian is a Software Engineer with more than ten years of experience in full life-cycle development, including analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and maintenance of application software in web-based environment, distributed N-tier architecture, and client/server architecture.

Name: Kelvin McDaniel
Bio: Kelvin McDaniel is a Tampa-based, Senior Developer at AgileThought. He graduated with an MBA from Florida A&M University in 2000 and has experienced a range of fields, including insurance and finance. He?s had a love for the various mobile flavors of Windows since the early CE days. He acquired his first Windows-based PDA (a Philips Nino) in 1998 while working in New York City. He and Cortana have a SERIOUS thing going on. ;)

Name: Sergey Barskiy
Bio: Sergey Barskiy is an architect with Tyler Technologies. He is a Microsoft MVP.  He holds the following certifications: MCPD, MCTS, MCSD for .NET, MCAD for .NET, MCDBA, MCP. He has been working with Microsoft technologies for over 15 years.  He is a frequent speaker at various regional and national conferences, such as VS Live, DevLink, CodeStock, and Atlanta Code Camp as well as local user groups.  He is one of the organizers of Atlanta Code Camp.

Name: Pete Skelly
Bio:
With over 20 years of experience in SMB and Enterprise application support, custom development, architecture design and project management, Pete's responsibilities as a Principal Consultant at ThreeWill range from solution design and development to account and project management across Financial Services, Healthcare, Insurance and Communications industries. Prior to ThreeWill, Pete worked for HP where he was a Technical Lead and Architect designing and developing world wide applications for service provisioning and help desk automation.
Pete holds a BA in Philosophy from the University of Hartford. Pete enjoys spending time with his wife and two sons, and the occasional round of golf.

Name: Shawn Wildermuth
Bio: Shawn Wildermuth is a thirteen-time Microsoft MVP (ASP.NET/IIS) and is involved with Microsoft as an ASP.NET Insider, ClientDev Insider and Windows Phone Insider. You may have taken one of his more than fifteen courses for Pluralsight including "Building a Web App with ASP.NET 5, MVC6, Entity Framework 7 and Angular 1.4" and "Bootstrap 3". He is also the author of eight books and dozens of articles on software development. He has been seen speaking at a variety of international conferences including TechEd, Oredev, SDC, VSLive, DevIntersection, MIX, DevTeach, DevConnections and DevReach. He is one of the Wilder Minds at http://wilderminds.com.  He can also be reached via his blog at http://wildermuth.com.
